boardgame.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Return of Ripsnarl
boardgame.description:
A new scenario for Battle for Greyport.

The Scenario comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 1

This scenario comes in two flavours of difficulty so both introductory and seasoned players should find a good time.

The Return of Ripsnarl! (For new players)
- Use the "Blood Moon Rising" scenario from the game, with the following changes:
- At the start of the game, after drawing opening hands, each player puts a Dragon Breath Ale promo card into their hand, for a total of 7 cards.
- Encounter 1 takes place at The Red Dragon Inn instead of the Dwarven Ruins.
- Encounter 2: During setup, each player gets a Doomwolf promo instead of a Werewolf. The Doomwolf's 2 threat counts towards each player's total threat. If Greyport City Hall is destroyed, each player gets a Werewolf as normal (not a Doomwolf.)
- Enounter 3: Use Werewolf tokens as normal. Ripsnarl has 20, 30, 35 or 45 HP for 2, 3, 4 or 5 players, respectively.
- Recommended rest healing: 2

The Return of Ripsnarl! (Advanced players)
- Use the "Blood Moon Rising" scenario from the game, with the following changes:
- At the start of the game, after drawing opening hands, each player puts a Dragon Breath Ale promo card into their hand, for a total of 7 cards.
- Encounter 1 takes place at The Red Dragon Inn instead of the Dwarven Ruins.
- Encounter 2: During setup, each player gets a Doomwolf promo instead of a Werewolf. The Doomwolf's 2 threat does not counts towards each player's total threat. If Greyport City Hall is destroyed, each player gets a Werewolf as normal (not a Doomwolf.)
- Enounter 3: Use Werewolf tokens as normal. Ripsnarl is Ranged (Use this card as a reminder.)
- Recommended rest healing: 1
RANGED

boardgame.name: Tea Time
boardgame.description:
Tea Time is an educational game to help children to collect ingredients to make their recipe.

How to play this game? The meaning of this game is to collect as first all the ingredients for your dessert. Each player receives a dessert and 5 ingredients in their hands at the start. The dessert is placed on the table in front of you. The remaining cards form the pile, the top card is turned over as the discard pile.

The player takes a card from the pile or puts it on the discard pile if he doesn't need it for his dessert. The player can also play an action card (bulbs) or put the ingredient next to their dessert if they match. Pick a new card until you have 5 cards in your hands.

The player who first collects all the ingredients for their dessert wins the game.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Luck Dice
boardgame.description:
The luck dice can be used instead of flipping the Luck Tokens.

Luck dice are given out as prizes at organized play events. Some were also given free at conventions.

boardgame.name: A Star in Her Eye
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The WARS Christmas Special from Arcbeatle Press features a bonus section with new Material for the RPG!

boardgame.name: Tiny Cthulhu
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can You Withstand the Onslaught of Cosmic Horror?

The classic TinyD6 minimalist ruleset delves into the unknowable and horrible mysteries of classic Mythos stories inspired by the works of Chambers, Lovecraft and more!

Using the rules in this book, you'll be able to play investigators, doomed heroes, and classic cosmic horror characters of all types, from scientists and librarians, to WWI veterans, to mysterious guardians defending the world from the dark powers of chthonic entities!

Tiny Cthulhu features a myriad of settings set throughout the world and history, ranging from prehistory to the Bronze Age, Age of Sail, World War 1, modern day, as well as fantasy and the science fiction future! You can survive cosmic horror in any time or place! (Lucky you!)

'Tiny Cthulhu features:

Minimalist Corruption rules focused on aiding storytelling.
New enemies, new Environment Traits to aid the otherworldly storytelling, and new rules for magic and tomes!
Support for Pulp-style storytelling!
Support for Noir-style storytelling!
Gadgets, steampunk themes and more are integrated into Tiny Cthulhu!

boardgame.name: The Fell Folk of the Moors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cruel attacks by strange dwarves in the Ilorin wood have disturbed the peace of Withgan village. Many fearful and angry people blame their dwarven neighbors, who profess innocence but proudly prepare to defend themselves. The faithful few of Withgan explore the perilous forest, uncover its mysteries, and restore security and trust to their home. These brave adventurers are up against more than ordinary bandits, but rather an ancient and fearsome people. Fantastical creatures, powerful magic, and fabulous treasures await discovery, as well as gruesome death for the unlucky and unwary.

boardgame.name: Liefde is... samen een spelletje spelen
boardgame.description:
'Liefde is ... samen een spelletje spelen' is Dutch for 'Love is ... playing a game together'.

You earn points ('hearts'), by guessing what answer another player gave to one of the personal questions on the game cards.

Some sample questions are

On my first date I always want ....
For a romantic weekend in my own country, I prefer to go to ....
In my previous life, I most likely was ....


The other players can randomly shout their answers, for 30 seconds.

boardgame.name: The Phlogiston Books Volume 3: The Carnival of Earthly Delights
The Phlogiston Books Volumen 3: El Carnaval de las Delicias Terrenales
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The people of Upper Coldcutters have been giving in to the blackmail of a group of bandits for some time now. Every year, the village's men take a load of cold cuts and preserved meats to a meeting point to exchange them for the bandits' "protection"; from a pig slaughter to the next one, a whole year. But this time, after going to the designated place with their invaluable cargo, the men didn’t get back home. Have they been the target of the bandits' capricious rage? Have they stumbled upon one of the many hazards that dot the Moiran fields? It is, then, up to the village's women to delve into this mystery and save their people from a bleak future.

This 0-level adventure/sandbox/campaign kickstarter for female player characters contains no more and no less than…

The barony of Moirás, a Rural Fantasy region adjacent to settlements as iconic as Humiliatown, Burgstard, or Shadypass, detailed in its countryside splendor.
Dozens of characters and creatures (well, maybe not so many) that will ring the fantasy players’ bell, so they’ll give them a good and nasty surprise.
Dozens (this time for sure) of adventure seeds and possible follow-ups to turn this module into the starting point for a rustic, bucolic, and very Chaotic campaign.
And as a commercial initiative of suspicious moral quality and efficiency, it includes mechanics, magic objects, and characters from previous The Phlogiston Books volumes and adventures, as an excuse to show a coherent milieu.



El pueblo de Chacineros de Arriba lleva tiempo cediendo al chantaje de un grupo de bandidos. Cada año, los hombres de la localidad llevan un cargamento de embutidos a un punto designado por los bandoleros a cambio de su protección hasta la siguiente matanza. Pero esta vez, tras dirigirse al lugar acordado con su preciosa carga, los hombres no han regresado. ¿Habrán incurrido en la caprichosa ira de los forajidos? ¿Se habrán topado con uno de los múltiples peligros que pueblan la campiña moireña? Queda pues en manos de las mujeres de la aldea desentrañar este misterio y salvar a su pueblo de un aciago destino.

Esta aventura/cajón de arena/inicio de campaña de nivel 0 para personajes femeninos contiene nada más y nada menos que...

La Baronía de Moirás, una región de Fantasía Rural colindante con enclaves tan emblemáticos como Humilladero, Malparida o Pasombrío, detallada en todo su esplendor campestre.
Decenas de personajes y criaturas (bueno, quizá son unos pocos menos) que le resultarán familiares a todos los jugadores de fantasía, y que por lo tanto les darán una buena y desagradable sorpresa.
Decenas (esta vez sí) de semillas de aventura y posibles continuaciones para convertir este módulo en punto de partida de una campaña rústica, bucólica y muy caótica.
Y como maniobra comercial de dudosa catadura moral y efectividad, integra reglas, objetos mágicos y personalidades de anteriores volúmenes y aventuras de The Phlogiston Books, con la excusa de mostrar una ambientación coherente.

boardgame.name: Call of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game
boardgame.description:
Along the southern fringes of Kilforth, the Ancients finalise their insidious plans and send forth the unstoppable gloom. Heroes and villains take to their ships, boasting loyalties to the imperious Blue Drake Navy or the lawless Sea Dogs. And as ill winds blow through the idyllic tropical archipelago, beneath the cerulean waves, great beings stir...

Call of Kilforth is the third Fantasy Quest Game: sequel and stand-alone expansion to Gloom of Kilforth, and Shadows of Kilforth. It is a game of high fantasy with a gothic edge, where 1-4 players, working individually or together, assume the roles of heroes on a journey through a dark world of magic and peril. They will visit strange places, meet stranger people and defeat powerful enemies in their mission to discover mysterious artefacts and mystical spells. Each player follows their hero’s tale, an epic saga from modest beginnings through to a climactic battle that will decide the fate of the world...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ogres Eleven: The Fantasy Heist Game
boardgame.description:
The crew is getting back together, Frank Ogre has one final grudge to settle and this time it's personal.

Play as one of eleven characters in this "Dungeons and Dragons"- inspired heist game.

Co-operatively plan your heist, utilising Fantasy Con-Artists, Lockpickers, Hired Muscle and Masterminds. Plant distractions, hack alarms and solicit bribes before attempting the job. Only the most devious players will stand any chance against the Central Bank and its monstrous Chairman!

Plan your heist carefully in the first phase of the game, marking out secret objectives to complete throughout the game to earn skill points and extra cash.

Be careful not to raise your "heat" too much- or the vault will be sealed and the heist will end dismally. Players win only when the vault is emptied and their character has successfully pulled off a secret win condition.

Ogre's Eleven uses a "legacy play" system that changes the heist each time you attempt it. With eleven playable characters, dozens of different skills/items, new patrol routes and changing security systems- even veteran players will come back over and over again to set new high scores and compete against their friends.

boardgame.name: Arkna: Sed de Poder
boardgame.description:
Arkna: Sed de Poder ("Arkna: thirst for power") is a Chilean trading card game were players take the role of powerful leaders of an army of fierce and unique races, commanding his units strategically towards the victory.
In this exciting game, the ability to take strategically decision each turn will make the difference.

To play Arkna, both players will need a deck of 50 to 60 cards. In each turn you can play a Gnosis, a card that represents a sort of energy from Gods. Using this energy, you can summon cards, like warriors. You can choose different kind of warriors: melee, ranged or mage.

In the field, there is a vanguard zone and a rear zone, depending on what zone do you play your warrior they will have different skills. You will also find a zone for structures, where you can play cards to build your fortress and help your warriors to improve their skills. Are you ready for power?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Expanders
boardgame.description:
How well can you expand numbers and connect areas to be the first to place all your tokens? Planning and applying addition skills will help you win this game.

Expanders is a game for children who like to add small numbers and enjoy strategy. There are easier and slightly more difficult versions of the game, and the board is different each time it is played, so players can't memorize an approach. Players also have choices about their plays, including making simple pairs or adding a sequence in horizontal, vertical or diagonal directions to make a sum and use up their tokens to win the game. Strategy is also important for blocking opponents. Children who have good spatial reasoning skills will also like this game.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Harpoon
boardgame.description:
This is the first edition of the Harpoon Modern Naval Miniatures Rules was published in 1981. It explained the basics of modern naval combat and allowed players to take on the role of a ship captain or formation commander.

It received the H.G. Wells award as the best miniatures game of 1980.

Because it described the technical aspects of naval warfare in an easily understood manner, an insurance agent in rural Maryland used it as one of his many data sources when he wrote a novel about modern submarines, titled The Hunt for Red October. The book did well.

boardgame.name: The Artemis Odyssey
Die Artemis-Odyssee
boardgame.description:
The Artemis Odyssey begins many generations after the events of The Artemis Project. Using the alien relics found deep in the oceans of the frozen moon Europa as a technological springboard, humankind has become quickly capable of reaching out to the distant stars...and to the mysterious orbiting planets.

Build powerful starships to cross the vast emptiness of interstellar space, land on uninhabited planets to find valuable resources. Establish your presence with colonies, factories, mighty terraformers. With luck you may even unearth more alien tech.

Your exploration is accomplished through a clever system of hidden planning on a shared board. When the planning board is full, it is resolved in sequence…with all players benefiting from each others’ plans! By anticipating what your opponents want to do next, where they want to go, and how they want to score, you’ll be able to squeeze the most out of your efforts, and ensure that your faction builds the greatest star-spanning network of them all!

Get ready to blaze a trail deep into the frontiers of the galaxy…The Artemis Odyssey begins now!

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q2 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Exclusive 'Odyssey' Pledge of The Artemis Odyssey Board Game by Grand Gamers Guild. Includes core game, Time Distender start player 3D miniature, 20 Starship 3D miniatures, 20 Colony 3D miniatures, 20 Factory 3D miniatures, 20 Terraformer 3D miniatures, Game Trayz inserts. Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: SaintCards: Base Game
boardgame.description:
SaintCards is a ground-breaking "true fact" card management system that helps players get to know facts about the lives of Catholic Saints. In a fun and interactive match-making, turn-based game, players vie to collect as many Treasures as possible before the end of the game.

The game begins with the dealer dealing a fixed number of cards to each player. The number of cards varies depending on the number of players. The remainder of the deck is placed face down to form the draw pile with the top card turned face up next to it to start the play pile.

In turn, each player aims to match at least one attribute of a card in his or her hand with an attribute of the top card in play. Players gain treasures (also called jewels) which are collected from the Storehouse of Treasure, with each additional matching attribute earning a player an additional treasure. Treasures take the physical form of game pieces of varying size and color, each corresponding to a different value and so function as the point scoring system for the game. On a single turn, a player may play a second card only if at least 3 matches between it and the card previously played can be identified.

Alternatively, or if a player is unable to find any matches, that player may draw a card from the draw pile instead.

Play moves to the next player in turn once a player says pass.

The game ends after one player has played his or her final card and the dealer has had a final chance to play. The player who has gathered the most treasure is the winner. That player then collects all the other players' treasures and lays them at the feet of Jesus, i.e. next to the Jesus Card. SaintCards Expansions add more saints and fun twists and turns to the gameplay.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: SaintCards: Doctors of the Church Expansion

boardgame.name: The Truth about Station 18
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The environment scanner beeps and displays three green bars: no radiation, no toxins and no foreign organisms. The air is indicated as Kua standard. You turn to your friends and show the sensor display.

They give the thumbs up. With a brief gesture, the captain gives command to proceed into the station. You step over the airlock threshold and are met by utter darkness. The only light is the slim finger of your helmet light, cutting a narrow path through the inky blackness.

From exo's fabric pocket you remove a sugar globe and some vacuum-packed sugar solution. Carefully, you cover the globe with the gel and rub it in. Slowly it starts to glow, first with a gentle light then brightening to a strong white. One last time you turn to the captain, who gives you a nod prompting you to roll the sugar globe down the yawning black corridor beyond the air lock. It bounces over the dirty floor before it sticks to something – is that a tree root?

This scenario was originally written for the first version of Coriolis and published in 2010. There has not been an English translation – until now. When reading this, you may notice big parallels with “Dark Flowers” from the Coriolis Quickstart. However, this version has a different – and darker - underlying mood. I have stuck closely to the Swedish original and made an attempt to update the stats to the current Coriolis version. As ever, feel free to vary them as you see fit.

boardgame.name: HeartSwitch Wizard Combo Pack
boardgame.description:
A compilation edition of two card games - Wizard and HeartSwitch.

This exciting new combo pack combines two of your favorite trick-taking card games into one convenient gift pack. The set includes two complete decks and instructions for two different card games.

In the award-winning Wizard Card Game, players try to win the exact number of tricks they bid.

The Wizard deck is similar to a regular deck of playing cards with the addition of four Wizards and four Jesters. Jesters always lose and Wizards always win. When you make your exact bid, you earn points. If you take too many or too few tricks, you lose points. The special, custom Wizard Score Sheet helps players keep track of bids and points. Wizard Card Game can be played with 2-6 players.

HeartSwitch is a completely new card game inspired by “Hearts”. The addition of special cards and unique concepts creates challenging situations that require Innovative strategies.

The object of the game is to have the lowest score at the end of the game.

The 60-card includes 2 good Witches and 2 bad Witches—they can help you or destroy you. Just when you are about to throw in the cards, the 4 Magicians come to your rescue!

HeartSwitch Wizard Combo Includes:

HeartSwitch Card Game
• Deck of 60 Cards
• Instructions
• Custom Score Sheets

Wizard Card Game
• Deck of 60 Cards
• Instructions
• Custom Score Sheets

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Stubborn as a Mule
boardgame.description: The 24 'Mule' cards are shuffled and placed face down on the table to form a track. Players roll the dice and move their Pawns along the track. The card you land on is turned over and the instructions followed. The object is to be the first player to reach the last card of the track by an exact count.

boardgame.name: The Lost City of Gaxmoor (5E)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The sun sinks slowly over the desolation of the ancient and once grand Empire.

In the distance, on the mesas that mark a broad valley, lie the ruins of a city, once the jewel in the Empire's crown. Her alabaster walls wind their way through the wilderness, guarding buildings both fair and ruined. It was a great city in its day, now long since fallen to the ravages of time and war. Long ago she stood as a shining doorway to the east, a place for rest and restocking of provisions for those on the long trek into the wildlands of the barbaric frontier in the Western Empire.

But all that is but a memory in this, the ruins of the Lost City of Gaxmoor.
What shades of her past glory remained are laid waste to the pillaging madness of man, goblin, and beast. Her walls breached, her towers stained with ruin, her houses pulled down.
The Lost City is a wreck of ruin and awash in fire and blood.

The Lost City of Gaxmoor includes over 200 areas of interest, 70 magical statues, scores of NPCs, dungeons, factions of humanoids, mercenary bands, monster lairs, and more. Throw in the machinations of ancient gods and the rise of a demon prince and you have a setting that just won't quit.

Designed for characters that range from 1st to 10th level.

The Lost City of Gaxmoor comes complete with a full-color fold-out map!

The Lost City of Gaxmoor is the brainchild of and written by Ernest G. Gygax and Luke Gygax, the sons of the legendary co-creator of Dungeons & Dragons, Gary E. Gygax.

boardgame.name: SENRAN KAGURA Peach Beach Splash - VALKYRIE DRIVE -BHIKKHUNI- Collaboration Pack
boardgame.description:
This DLC pack includes the following items:
Playable Characters 'Rinka Kagurazaka' and 'Ranka Kagurazaka'
New Paradise Swimsuit 'OTOHIME'
New Paradise Swimsuit 'LORELEI'
Avatar Icon, Hair, Badge, Doll, Fan, and Flag for both characters

boardgame.name: Weapons of Gaxmoor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The rumors and legends of Gaxmoor are much-storied, and the weapons of Gaxmoor reflect this rich history. They range from blades to bows that are oft times more famous than those who carried them. Steeped in magic and with names their own, these weapons are shrouded in the legends and fables of the lost Empire and of those who survived its fall.

Within Weapons of Gaxmoor are several dozen special magic weapons. Each entry comes complete with a history, legendary status, the personality of the weapon, its level of sentience, abilities, and restrictions.

Unleash the weapons of Gaxmoor.

boardgame.name: SENRAN KAGURA Peach Beach Splash - Ikki Tōsen EE Collaboration Pack
boardgame.description:
This Downloadable Content Contains:

Lu Bu Character Set
Lu Meng Character Set
Sun Ce Character Set
Guan Yu Character Set
(Character Set includes Playable Character, Hair, and Badge)
Lu Bu's Outfit
Lu Meng's Outfit
Sun Ce's Outfit
Guan Yu's Outfit
Ikki Tousen EE Flag Set
Ikki Tousen EE Fan Set
Ikki Tousen EE Wooden Doll Set

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Long Valley (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The valley was tamed long ago. The deep gorges bridged, a road cut through her swampy bottoms, and towers built for the safety of travelers. But that was when the kingdoms of men were young and strong. Now, the valley is empty, her guardians long gone, the towers in ruin, the road in disrepair, and her people scattered. In their place creatures have crept, deadly and mad, settling in crevices and gorges, preying on all who wander down the long, lonesome valley.

The Long Valley is an overland adventure that allows the characters to explore the whole 30 mile stretch of country. The challenges range from the monstrous to the terrain, itself. Originally designed for use with the Lost City of Gaxmoor, but easily portable to any setting or game.

This stand-alone adventure is designed for use with 3-6 characters of 3rd-5th level.

boardgame.name: The Scrolls of Maega
boardgame.description:
The Scrolls of Maega is a board game of tactical confrontation & strategic movement set in a dark fantasy universe. It's an asymmetric tactical RPG for 3 to 6 players, with a modular board. Players have limited actions to prepare & cast spells, manage their hand & resources, and survive the maze.

LORE - SETTING:
Players are power-hungry sorcerers in search of a long lost divine scroll of power. They will need to foil their opponents and the dangers of the maze to find the key, retrieve the artefact and race back to the exit; knowing that anyone left behind could be waiting on their way back.

OBJECTIVE:
Players will attempt to retrieve the Scroll at the end of the dungeon and make their way back out with it. However, they must first find the Relic (key) among the hidden items randomized on the Treasure tiles.

SETUP:
Players start by choosing their game mode: Battle Royale or Team battle (or Cooperative, coming in an expansion). The game is played in 4 phases of 3 turns each, for a maximum of 12 turns.

At first, players set the tiles to create the board, using a recommended or custom layout. Treasure tiles (items to collect) and Wall tiles (restricting movement/targeting) are safe to walk on, but most tiles bare Runes that will damage the players health & mana.

They then select their characters, using the starting deck provided or customizing their strategy (for experienced players). Each begins with the same number: a free spell, 7 spells in-hand, 1 trap card in hand, and 1 trap card in their personal discard pile.

Players then order their 4 Divination cards, each offering them cumulative bonuses during one of the game's 4 phases. And once the turn-order is decided (by drawing numbered tokens), the first player can enter the maze. The game begins.

GAMEPLAY:
Players aim to find the Relic among the hidden items, going to each Treasure tile and getting stronger in the process. With the Relic in their possession (secretly or not), they can take the Scroll from the shrine. But any item can be stolen from other players, so escaping with it will be challenging.

Players have 4 actions available per turn (moving up to 2-3 tiles, preparing a spell, casting any number of prepared spells, using an item, healing health or mana, etc.)

Mostly, players use their actions to prepare spells in advance (one action by level, up to 3); or to cast one or more spells they had prepared, so players will always need to anticipate their future needs. Spells are used to attack, move yourself or others, heal, or disable opponents. Only a disabled opponent can be looted.

Trap cards (Tenacity cards) can be used for free in reaction to a spell targeting them. Once used, it is removed from the game. Each player has two Tenacity cards (one in hand and one in the discard pile at the start of the game).

Except for your free spell, all used spells are then discarded. However, a tenacity track goes up with every health or mana lost or spent, allowing you to retrieve cards in your personal discard pile.

If a player falls to 0 HP with mana remaining, it's not over just yet. Next turn, they'll be disabled and will need to exchange their mana for health. But more rarely, if a player falls to 0 HP & Mana, they'll die for good; winning is now out of reach, but as a vengeful spirit with limited actions, the player still has a role to play (either haunting its murderer or helping its team).

The game ends as soon as a player gets back to the starting portal with the Scroll in hand. So, select your character, build your strategy around their unique playstyle, and rush to the scroll or wait to steal it. In the end, only one Maegan will get the Scroll.

boardgame.name: Patchwork People of Adam
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a new background for Troika! Numinous Edition, for creatures who have been stitched together from corpses.

This is a single page layered PDF. See the video for printing help.

Image: Jacob E. Blackmon

Compatible with Troika! "Patchwork People of Adam" is an independent production by Azukail Games and is not affiliated with the Melsonian Arts Council.

boardgame.name: 100 Ceilings to Find in a Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Ceilings are an important part of any room and this supplement provides 100 different ceilings that can be added to a dungeon. These could be used as a source of potential curiosities or hazards, or perhaps as potential adventure hooks. Alternatively, they may simply be used as a way to flesh out an otherwise uninteresting room and, perhaps, pose a puzzle that lacks a true answer.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

The ceiling is hidden in deep shadows that seem to swallow the light. A faint chittering noise is coming from within the shadows.

The ceiling smoothly arches upwards into a dome of polished stone.

The ceiling's rock has been carved into facets, with each facet carefully painted in different shades of green, giving the impression that it is made of emerald.

The earth of the ceiling has been fused into a glassy sheet by intense heat.

The natural stone of the ceiling has been painted and carved to resemble a huge grinning skull.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and one page is ads.

boardgame.name: Dramaria Sector (SB&CS)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In the Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells universe, the universe is comprised of sectors to adventure in with odd encounters, strange locations and dangerous inhabitants. This supplement has a new sector, Dramaria, which is all about entertainment. Primarily not scripted entertainment, but reality shows, ones in which the deaths of participants are not only common but intended. There is a d66 table of hex contents, a d20 table of visions, a 2d6 table of encounters and a d10 table of adventure opportunities.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter, one page is ads and one the Open Game License.

Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells™ is a trademark of Diogo Nogueira.

boardgame.name: Character Expansion Handbook: Solarians
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Usher in a revolution of Starfinder player options with Everybody Games's Character Expansion Handbook! Forged by the folks who write Starfinder and honed to Everybody Games's trademark edge, the Character Expansion Handbook unlocks new realities for a specific Starfinder class in every issue!

In this issue of the Character Expansion Handbook, solarian affectionato Sasha Laranoa Harving unleashes all-new alternate class features, stellar revelations, and zenith revelations for solarian characters! Express your sidereal influences with combat tactics or and other unique powers, embrace the pallid glow of the moon rather than stellar influences, modify your solar manifestations with all-new soulforged revelations, marvel at all-new zenith revelations that allow characters to choose whether they are graviton or photon aligned, and so much more!

boardgame.name: Florida Man
boardgame.description: There have been some crazy stories coming out of Florida these days, it seems truth is stranger than fiction! In Florida Man, travel your way through the state, from Pensacola to Key West, learning about some of the wacky things that have happened here, and some things that have not, by guessing which of these outrageous Florida Man headlines is NOT true! Each round, players will vote on which headlines they think are false. Winning voters will move forward a single space on the board, while incorrect guesses stay where they are for that round.

boardgame.name: Hunted: Wode Ridge
boardgame.description:
They say the town of Wode Ridge has been cursed ever since Amos Wode founded the place way back in the 1800s. The sleepy, Colorado tourist trap looks plum peaceful in its postcards, but there’s a darkness about the town you can’t quite put your finger on. Some even say the town has an “other side” where the crazy roams unchecked, but I can’t speak much to that.

By the 1980s, things had gotten especially weird--at least until a bunch of kids started snooping around trying to get to the bottom of the town’s supernatural goings-on. While the adults were worried about their Tupperware parties, these youngsters were out tracking down clues and finding trouble before it found them. And rumor has it they found some kind of creature in the woods too which might explain all them FBI fellers around here asking questions.

And here they come now, riding around town on their bicycles. I just hope they figure things out soon. Looks like some kind of dark cloud is rolling in right behind them.

Overview:
Take on the role of a group of kids and their newfound alien friend, and explore Wode Ridge looking for evidence of the town’s supernatural happenings. But be wary, the Darkness knows you’re on to it, so it’ll be trying to get you before you get it. Find enough evidence to figure out what monster is currently ailing the town and then defeat it before time runs out and the Darkness overtakes you.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Draconic Dice
boardgame.description:
Be the first player to get rid of all of your dice to win Draconic Dice.

Roll dragons and dispatch them to invade your opponents. Any injured knights rolled flee and are removed from the game. Roll fireballs, and those dice are moved to the center of the play area to build an ever-growing fire pit — but be careful because if you fail to roll any fireballs on your turn, you get "burned" and must take all the center dice for yourself! Will you dispatch your dragons to vanquish your foes and go out in a blaze of glory?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sherlock Holmes Beratender Detektiv: Der Munitionsmagnat
boardgame.description:
In this cooperative game, you investigate criminal cases along with the most notorious detective of all time. Follow the leads and gather clues. Go with your team and explore London in the Victorian era. To beat Sherlock Holmes at this game, carefully read the newspapers, follow your intuition, and use your deduction capacities.

This is case 1 from Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Thames Murders & Other Cases, which has been made available on its own as a Print & Play in Germany.
boardgame.videogamebg: Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective Vol. II

boardgame.name: Investiture
boardgame.description:
Go through the ranks in making yourself the greatest stock market trader the world has ever seen! Investiture is modeled after various stock markets around the world, enabling you to understand how transactions work and all the while grow rich. It combines the intensity of the stock market with the strategy to become rich and have fun! This game requires no prior knowledge of how stock markets work! Be careful, because your decisions will affect every other player in the market!

On a turn a player may buy a stock, short a stock, or sell a stock they currently own. They may also play one of the lucky break cards in their hand. They get 3 turns per round and after each player has taken 3 turns, one at a time, all the cards are thrown in the middle to reflect the price changes of the stock.

The game is won when the players have decided to end the game. We typically suggest 10 rounds for full gameplay. The player who has the highest value in terms of cash in hand and stock market value on the board is declared the winner!

listing.notes: Free two day Shipping. Have many games available for sale!

boardgame.name: Cloudspire: Cloud Spider
boardgame.description:
Cloud Spider is a landmark minion chip that was the 2020 convention promo chip for Chip Theory Games.
This chip is also available in the Chip Theory Games 2020 Promo Pack.

Stats:
Swamp Landmark Chip
5 Health
* Attack
2 Movement
Poison Talent
Spire Reward - 1 Relic Reward

boardgame.name: Vis mon camp! en Bourgogne - Franche-Comté
boardgame.description:
Vis mon camp ! en Bourgogne - Franche-Comté is a navigation game.

Each player starts from an EEDF (Eclaireurs & Eclaireuses de France) group in the region and has to go find other groups to make a camp on a field.
This allows the player to cross the region to get to the groups they need to camp with, then make a second trip to the camp location, finding out about the various local groups and their locations.
When a player reaches a location he scores points (shown on the "camp" cards).

First player to reach 100pts wins the game.

boardgame.name: Franche-Comté: Toute la Franche-Comté en 2000 questions
boardgame.description:
A Trivia game about the Region of Franche-Comté in eastern France.
2000 questions in 5 themes covering:

History,
Culture and traditions,
Economy,
Geography & Tourism,
Sport & contemporary life


A player rolls dice and moves on the board accordingly. Depending on the color of the destination square, player draws a card and answer the questions of a different category. If the answer is incorrect it goes to the next player (or team).
The winner is the first player (team) to collect 5 colored "stage" cards.

It is possible to play in teams.

boardgame.name: You Don't Know Jack: Movies Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
This add-on set for the tabletop YOU DON'T KNOW JACK game includes 113 cards with 452 additional questions about you favorite feature films of the past & present. Like the original, each question has that wacky YDKJ twist to make it that much more interesting and challenging!

NOTE: Unlike the TV expansion, where the last card in the set has only two questions on it, all the cards in this set have the full 4 questions on them, making for 452 total questions.

boardgame.name: Sentinel Comics: The Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
In Sentinel Comics: The Roleplaying Game, you and your friends play as comic-book heroes - either from the pages of Sentinel Comics or from your own imagination! Join forces against terrible villains and fight in dangerous environments, all in a tabletop roleplaying game!

The core rulebook teaches you everything you need to play Sentinel Comics: the Roleplaying Game, whether playing a hero, or running the game as the GM. It has full, robust rules for hero creation (that we will be showcasing more in an update, coming soon!), as well as a vast set of tools for GMs to create their own minions, lieutenants, challenges, villains, environments, doomsday devices, action scenes, and so much more!

boardgame.name: Sentinel Comics: The Roleplaying Game Game Moderator Kit
boardgame.description:
From Back of Box:

This Game Moderator Kit for Sentinel Comics: The Roleplaying Game includes useful tools for running super-powered RPG Adventures!


A double-sided dry-erase scene tracker with a standard scene tracker on one side and a black and white, customizable scene tracker on the other
A total of 16 double-sided dry-erase challenge, minion and lieutenant cards
6 blank dry-erase cards for you to use as needed for tracking hero turns in the action order or whatever dastardly deeds your villians may hae up their sleeves
A tear-off pad of 100 full-color double-sided blank hero character sheets
A tear-off pad of 100 full-color double-sided blank hero villain sheets
A 4-panel GM Screen with exciting, full-color art on one side and a ton of handy info on the other

boardgame.name: Off The Rails
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In this one-shot issue, the international organization G.L.O.B.A.L is transporting a group of powerful prisoners to a rocket launch pad via maglev train in order to send them to a new underground prison on the moon. However, something goes wrong and the heroes have to break into the train to regain control and figure out what's going on.

boardgame.name: Sentinel Comics: The Roleplaying Game Coloring Book
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The art of Sentinel Comics needs you!

Step into the shoes of a comic book color artist with these 20 line art illustrations from the pages of Sentinel Comics! Featuring arts of heroes, villains, lieutenants, minions, environments and more, this book is full of art to spark your imagination and provide a canvas to fill with your choice of colored pencil, marker or paint. Each page is perforated, so your art can be removed from the book and displayed in a place of honor.

Bring your own colors to the world of Sentinel Comics.

boardgame.name: Urban Infestation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Urban Infestation
A.K.A. “The Bugs and the Birds”

In this one-shot issue, the hero team Daybreak shows up in grim and gritty Rook City to deal with one of their first foes: the living mass of bugs, Myriad. What the heroes haven’t counted on is that Rook City is rife with chaos rifts, Myriad is using to cause extra havoc, making him an extraordinarily dangerous opponent. The heroes cross paths with another hero team, Dark Watch, and team up with them to seal away the rifts and drive away Myriad.

Urban Infestation assumes that you, or someone else in your game group, has a copy of the Sentinel Comics RPG Starter Kit or the Sentinel Comics RPG Core Rulebook. Also, this issue takes place after the one-shot Stolen Legacy–more information on Daybreak can be found there–but you do not have to have played that issue to play this one.

boardgame.name: Wild State: The Game of American Power Grab
boardgame.description:
OVERVIEW: This is an election theme board game, but make no mistake about it. This isn't a political game. It is a territorial game where opponents fight for majority of votes on the states, and win General Elections. There is a luck component that is easily tamed with plenty of strategies. Strategies get pretty sophisticated as players develop their skills overtime. In a way it resembles a weird mix of poker and chess without following any of their rules. In other words, it is not a twisted version of either. The goal of the game is to win majority in the states, thereby winning Super PACs to fund your campaigns, and ultimately win 3 General Elections.

AUDIENCE: Simple enough for casual players and advanced for professional gamers.

UNIQUE: This game is played continuously. After every game, you can save the setup with its unique challenges for the next time you play. Simply snap a picture of the board. Probably, this is the only "competitive" game where really it is almost impossible to eliminate an opponent from the game (no player elimination).

IMPORTANT..!
Manufacturer strongly recommends you limit a game to 3 General Elections wins rather than 5 as stated in the rules, for a better game experience.

boardgame.name: Clash of Spears: Fields of Blood
boardgame.description:
Fields of Blood is an expansion to CLASH of Spears

This expansion currently includes:

Rules for designing solo scenarios and two ready to play solo scenarios
Rules for fighting assaults on fortifications
Rules for fighting engagements in urban areas
Two new scenarios including an assault scenario
New rules to add special skills to your characters


This is a living document and as we add new material you will be able to simply download the updated version.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Clash of Spears: Rules for Skirmish Battles in Ancient Times

boardgame.name: Le Pays de Lorient Par le Jeu
boardgame.description:
While playing, discover the 19 municipalities of the Pays de Lorient through 30 remarkable tourist sites!

The board represents the 19 municipalities of the region of Lorient.
The players move and visit the various tourist sites in the region.
Rolling the dice they can use roads, by bus or taxi,
In each municipality, there are 1 to 3 sites that are deliberately different and remarkable, leisure activities, exceptional places, museums, heritage and some history.

Goal
The first player who collect 10 sites in 10 different communes is the winner.

Gameplay
Use a combination of dice and "transportation" cards to race around the board.
Each player starts with a hand of 4 cards.
To visit a site a player needs to stop exactly on the red space representing it and own the corresponding card in his / her hand. It is then put face-up as a proof of the visit.
At the beginning of its turn, a player refills her/his hand to 4 cards first before rolling the dice (only once per turn).
Special cards allow special movement bonuses, or penalties to delay other players.

boardgame.name: Book 1: Players
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Portray Mythic Heroes:
You play as fantasy heroes of myths and legends. Discover your hero's story from rich vision images and collaborative questions. Create your own fantastic powers and magic.

Gateway to a Thousand Worlds:
Explore many cultures and realms as you quest across a thousand spheres connected by mystic gates. At the crossroads of these spheres lies the ancient city of Everway.

Powered by the Fortune Deck:
Everway is a diceless game where actions in the game are resolved by Karma, Drama, and Fortune.

Silver Anniversary Edition:
The twenty-fifth anniversary edition has a mix of more than 150 vision images, an easy-to-read layout, an expanded setting, new rules options and improvements, over 100 new creatures, new maps, and three new quests. It is divided between Book 1: Players and Book 2 Gamemasters.

boardgame.name: 7 Wonders: Geekmod Insert
boardgame.description: Wooden organizer compatible with 7 Wonders, made from 3mm birch plywood

boardgame.name: Rayman Adventures
boardgame.description:
Rayman Adventures is an action-packed adventure game available as free download for iOS devices. Embark on epic adventures to rescue the Incrediballs!

The enchanted forest is in trouble; the ancient eggs that sustain the sacred tree have been stolen and scattered across the world

From haunted medieval castles to the mythical worlds of Olympus, Rayman, our fearless adventurer, and Barbara, his Viking companion, set out in search of the Incrediballs’ eggs to breathe new life into the sacred tree!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Il gioco di Paperopoli
boardgame.description:
On the hunt for the missing keys to Scrooge's warehouse.
It's a board game similar to Monopoly where the goal is to recover three keys to open the Scrooge's warehouse. But beware of the path full of traps where every Disney character with his peculiar abilities can pass them unscathed or suffer them.
Who will arrive first? Donald Duck, The Beagle Boys, Daisy Duck, Huey Dewey and Louie, Magica De Spell, Gladstone Glander or Scrooge McDuck?
A Disney adventure suitable for children.

—user summary

boardgame.name: One Piece: Adventure Island
boardgame.description:
One Piece is a Straw Hat Pirate Showdown game that has 3 play modes: Child, Story and Crew Battle. From 8 years old.

Use Cards and Dice to advance through the Islands of the Grand Line and complete missions and become the King of the Pirates

STORY MODE

Relive all the adventures of the Straw Hat Crew in this cooperative mode, but beware of the pirates and Marines who will do anything to plunder your ship and capture you. Drop Crocodile in Alabasta, destroy CP9, face the crew of Big Mom or Kaido ...

THE BATTLE BETWEEN CREW MODE

Each player plays one of 12 pirate crews and sets out to conquer the many islands of the One Piece world. Will you be the fastest to control territories, find as many treasures as possible on the islands, carry out your missions and beat your many enemies? Beware of other crews, Marines, 7 Corsairs, Supernovae and 4 Emperors who could at any time put an end to your dreams of piracy.

Who will be the Pirate Lord?

boardgame.name: Slingshot Maneuver
boardgame.description:
The core mechanic of Slingshot Maneuver is based on a real technique used by NASA to save on fuel when sending unmanned spacecraft into the outer solar system. They will use the gravity of planets as a “slingshot” to get a boost in speed and reduce fuel consumption.

Two military forces fight for control of the solar system, and slingshot maneuvers are very important to their strategies. Ships equipped with advanced stealth technology are only visible when they fire their boosters. Therefore, firing your rockets out of site of the enemy, and using slingshot maneuvers to conduct attacks on unsuspecting enemies can be absolutely devastating.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 4Mation
포메이션
boardgame.description:
The aim is to strategically place cubes in your colour to
create a horizontal, vertical or diagonal row of 4.

4Mation is played using the cube tray inside the box. Each player takes all the cubes of one colour.

The players take turns to play one of their cubes. Important: Each cube can only be placed in a space that is adjacent (othogonally or diagonally) to the last cube, your opponent played!

The game ends as soon as one player has at least 4 cubes in
their colour in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal row. That
player is the winner. If neither player is able to complete a
row of 4, the game ends in a draw.

—description from the publisher

There is no time limit - it all depends on the skill of the investigator.

boardgame.name: Quest for Oil
boardgame.description:
RELEASED - DEFUNCT GAME




The game is no longer playable in any form.





User summary

Business strategy game with simulation about the oil business.

boardgame.name: Twisting Chess
boardgame.description:
Twisting Chess adds 2 new characters to the original chess game with different abilities for a new game balance. Twisting Chess is a game for all ages and levels of competency in the original game. Fun for new as well as experienced chess players!

The classic Chess game is a fantastic game for young and old. It's fairly easy to learn, but super hard to master. This is often considered a reason not to play the game. Especially nowadays with mobile devices, the barrier to master this versatile game is quite high. Twisting Chess aims to break down that barrier and make it fun and challenging to play for experienced as well as new players.

When you play twisting chess, we assume a basic knowledge of the original game. That means that we expect you to understand the basic abilities of the pieces, but that's all. Of course you may have a competitive advantage when you know some basic strategies, but don't be fooled, because the two new characters we introduce can ruin your intentions in the blink of an eye.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Parallel Worlds (Issue 17 - Jan 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue: Auxiliary London 2039, Baldur’s Gate III, Core Space, Dungeons & Dragons, DigiSprite, Gamesmasterclass, Legendary Encounters, mini of the month, online escape rooms, original fiction, The Hammer and the Blade, X-Files

boardgame.name: Meeple Circus: Tiny Acrobats
boardgame.description:
A new way to play Meeple Circus! Tiny Acrobats combines the excitement and thrills of Meeple Circus, with new streamlined scoring and rules set. Using a combination of new components provided in this expansion and components from your copy of Meeple Circus, The Wild Animal & Areal Show and Show Must Go On! Here's a whole new way to enjoy Meeple Circus.

Provided in Tiny Acrobats:


25 public demand cards
2 sizes of ruler (one for the giant edition and one for the regular size)
New rules set


What is used from the base game and expansions:

Meeples
Scoreboard "The Clap-o-meter"
5 Circus Rings
5 Score Tokens

This addition to your Meeple Circus collection can be played with the standard-sized meeples or the GIANT sized meeples. The measurement scoring is different from the original game which is why we are including two sizes of rulers folded on heavy card stock in the box.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Meeple Circus: Show Must Go On!
Meeple Circus: The Wild Animal & Aerial Show

boardgame.name: TrollsZine (Issue 10 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

TrollsZine 10 has arrived to mark ten years since it was first published and to wish the illustrious Trollgod, Ken St Andre, a swift recovery. The original team of Bill Pitcher and Dan Prentice have returned to bring you the best free Tunnels & Trolls magazine on the web. In this issue we have Ken St Andre expounding on his new deadly combat rules, solo adventures by Sid Orpin and James Fallows, a gamesmaster adventure by Nicholas Bergquist and meditations on life as a fairy by David Lucardie and about ensuring the combat odds are always in your favour by Randy Whitley. Featuring great art by David Ullery, Jeff Freels, Peter Mackenzie and the multitalented Sid Orpin, James Fallows and Bill Pitcher. To round things off we have a hand drawn geomorph map by John Prentice – just waiting for your monsters to fill it. By gamers, for gamers.

boardgame.name: Ordination
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The party arrives at the city of Cathoway and discovers that a new cleric is set to head the Church of Oghma! They quickly discover that a problem has arisen in that the four Clerics up for the honor have all disappeared! The game is afoot!

The scenario was designed for a quartet of first level PCs. This offering was a fantastic time for the Murder Hobo Inc. podcast show on Twitch.

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #2 - Jan 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:

The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magic items like the staff of draconic power, blizzard bottle, candle crown, and the biting blade of ten thousand blossoms!
Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like accursed monolith, gate of the faithful, shield of dawn, and wall of light!
Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the goldbug, guardian scroll, and book golem!

boardgame.name: Temple of the Verdant Solitaire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

One tale shared among the treasure hunters who adventure into the Great Uannat-tuan Jungle speaks of the lost Temple of the Verdant Solitaire. It tells of a towering stone edifice constructed over two centuries ago under the orders of Sovereign Prince Un’di-eed for his consort, Sadda-gurra, High Priestess of Essenuok. As a tribute to the temple’s given name, the resident priests used their jewel-crafting skills to create an exceptional jade brooch for their high priestess. Many believe the vanished temple still houses the prized jewel. What they don’t know are the dangers that await them within.

Temple of the Verdant Solitaire is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 10th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Cazilus & Rismerral: Awakened Familiar Tamer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I swear, Cazilus," scoffed a dragon almost as green as his feline companion's eyes, "with the reputation you've made for yourself, I hardly need to join you on such small heists anymore." Cazilus stretched her front legs dramatically before finally lying down on her silk pillow, nestled against Rismerral for warmth.

"Perhaps not, but maybe it's time we set our eyes on a greater prize." Cazilus purred.

Once the pet of a traveling wizard, Cazilus's life truly began when her master was slain by the green wyrmling Rismerral. Shocked into a life as an Awakened Familiar but quick on her feet, Cazilus convinced the infant dragon of her value as a spy and partner in crime.

This supplement includes:

Information on the tamer NPC Cazilus and her dragon companion Rismerral.
Stat blocks for Cazilus at a Challenge Rating of 1/2, 4, and 7, to fight alongside a green dragon wyrmling, young green dragon, and adult green dragon from your RPG library.


This supplement combines new character options from TBM Games' tamer class and Underground Oracle's awakened familiar race.

boardgame.name: The Tamer: Trappers, Dragon Masters, and Summoners
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The undisputed masters of handling monsters, tamers bring the fiercest creatures of the world into battle with them. With their encyclopedic knowledge of the dangers of the wilderness, a tamer will seldom find themselves alone in a fight.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules for character creation, this PDF introduces a new class, the Tamer. These adventurers use their unique skills to bring companion monsters into battle.

This PDF contains three subclasses for the tamer:

The Trapper, who captures ferocious beasts to battle for them while assembling traps to redefine a fight.
The Dragon Master, who negotiates the assistance of chromatic dragons, and in doing so develop a legendary reputation themselves.
The Summoner, who captures the essence of fey, fiends, and elementals in an enchanted deck of cards.

boardgame.name: Leaving Las Vegas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Where were you when the apocalypse happened? Well, we'd like to think you were here playing "Dead End: Leaving Las Vegas" where you get to be the ones who wake up to face the nightmare!

An amazing character funnel with character generation rules attached where you play a group of people who have to face the rising horde and get out of Vegas.

boardgame.name: Which Would You Pick?
boardgame.description: Two decks of 40 cards contain amusing, hypothetical situations. The player on turn draws a card from each deck and secretly decides which situation he or she would rather participate in. The other players then attempt to guess which card was selected. Play proceeds clockwise to the next player. An alternative way to play involves all the players discussing which situation they would choose for themselves.

boardgame.name: 8-Bit Splatch
boardgame.description: You're looking for a colourful pixeled paintball capture the flag? That's oddly specific! But hey, we got you covered! 8-bit Splatch is a game of luck and strategy. 2 players (or teams) control shooters in two different colours, as they attempt to steal each other's flags. You use your action points to move around the board, grab the flag, and send enemy shooters straight to the hospital. Beware though, as you'll have to deal with the VIP, a super-shooter who is on both teams at once. If you can dodge the hail of paintballs from the other team and the VIP, you can claim the flag back to the base, and see if it is real. If it is, congratulations, you won! If not, then its back into the battlefield you go...

boardgame.name: Poulterheist
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's NecronomiCon 2017. You are going to undertake the greatest heist the world has ever seen. Two things:

1 - You have a complex plan that requires precise timing.

2 - You are god-damned (literally) undead

boardgame.name: The Witcher (1-Page)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a Witcher.

You are angry and you slay monsters.
boardgame.rpgpodcastepisode: 'The Witcher' Honey Heist hack with Ross Payton #1: Owl Parts
'The Witcher' Honey Heist hack with Ross Payton #2: Debt Collection

boardgame.name: Maddening Mystery
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It is the jazz age. Dark and wonderous forces are gathering just under the surface of the commonplace.

Two Things -


One: The dark revulsion and fascination with this hidden world grows stronger every day.



Two: Humanity means bupkis to the Old Ones.
